alert.note: Alert for Bee; Duval; Jim Wells; Live Oak; McMullen (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:18PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Duval, southeastern McMullen, northwestern Jim Wells, Live Oak and northwestern Bee Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 618 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Choke Canyon to near Seven Sisters. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... George West, Three Rivers, Choke Canyon, Mineral, Seven Sisters, Loma Alta, River Creek Acres, Calliham, Nell, Annarose, Karon, Rancho De La Parita, Oakville, Crowther, Pawnee, Simmons, Ray Point, Whitsett, Esseville and Clegg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 54 and 83. US Highway 281 between mile markers 618 and 648. US Highway 59 between mile markers 714 and 758. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bee; Duval; Jim Wells; Live Oak; McMullen
